title: Poetry Forms Quiz
description: From sonnets to haiku, test your knowledge of the many beautiful forms poetry can take

questions.question: How many lines does a traditional sonnet have?
A haiku is a Japanese poem with how many syllables in its three lines?
What is a 'limerick'?
options: A humorous five-line poem with an AABBA rhyme scheme

questions.question: What is an 'epic' poem?
options: A poem that does not rhyme
A poem written in a single stanza
A long narrative poem that tells the story of a hero's adventures

questions.question: Which of these is a famous epic poem?
options: Stopping by Woods on a Snowy Evening

questions.question: What is a 'ballad'?
options: A narrative poem or song that tells a story, often with a refrain
A poem with exactly six lines

questions.question: What is an 'ode'?
options: A lyric poem that addresses or celebrates a particular subject with elevated style

questions.question: Keats's 'Ode on a Grecian Urn' is an example of which poetic form?
What is an 'elegy'?
options: A poem with no fixed structure
A poem of serious reflection, typically mourning the dead

questions.question: A 'villanelle' is a poem with how many lines?
Which famous poem by Dylan Thomas is a villanelle?
options: Do Not Go Gentle into That Good Night

questions.question: What distinguishes a Shakespearean sonnet from a Petrarchan sonnet?
options: Petrarchan sonnets are always about love
A Shakespearean sonnet has three quatrains and a couplet; a Petrarchan has an octave and a sestet

questions.question: What is a 'couplet' in poetry?
options: A pair of poets who write together

questions.question: What is a 'sestina'?
options: A complex form with six stanzas of six lines each, plus a three-line envoi, using repeated end-words
A poem about the six seasons
A poem written for six voices

questions.question: What is a 'quatrain'?
options: A stanza or group of four lines
A poem about the four seasons
